lines.code: # The Porter2 stemming algorithm (or "Porter stemmer") is a process for removing the commoner
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # morphological and inflexional endings from words in English.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Its main use is as part of a term normalisation process that is usually done
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # when setting up Information Retrieval systems.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # C.J. van Rijsbergen, S.E. Robertson and M.F. Porter, 1980.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # London: British Library. (British Library Research and Development Report, no. 5587).
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Comments throughout the source code were taken from:
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Note: this module is optimized for performance.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # There is little gain in using more regular expressions.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """ A short syllable in a word is either:
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: - a vowel followed by a non-vowel other than w, x or Y and preceded by a non-vowel
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: - a vowel at the beginning of the word followed by a non-vowel.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: Checks the three characters before the given index in the word (or entire word if None).
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: i = before<0 and len(w)+before or before
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: if len(w) == 3 and is_consonant(w[0]) and is_vowel(w[1]) and is_consonant(w[2]) and w[2] not in "wxY":
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: if len(w) == 2 and is_vowel(w[0]) and is_consonant(w[1]):
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """ A word is called short if it consists of a short syllable preceded by zero or more consonants.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: return is_short_syllable(w[-3:]) and len([ch for ch in w[:-3] if ch in VOWELS]) == 0
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # A point made at least twice in the literature is that words beginning with gener-
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # are overstemmed by the Porter stemmer:
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Moving the region one vowel-consonant pair to the right fixes this:
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """ R1 is the region after the first non-vowel following a vowel,
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: or the end of the word if there is no such non-vowel.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """ R2 is the region after the first non-vowel following a vowel in R1,
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: or the end of the word if there is no such non-vowel.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """ Returns the index of the first vowel in the word.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: When no vowel is found, returns len(word).
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: if ch in VOWELS: return i
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """ Returns True if there is a vowel in the given string.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: if ch in VOWELS: return True
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """ Returns the number of consecutive vowel-consonant pairs in the word.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: if is_vowel(ch) and i<len(w)-1 and is_consonant(w[i+1]):
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # An optimisation to stop searching once we reach the amount of <vc> pairs we need.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Replace by -ie if preceded by just one letter,
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # otherwise by -i (so ties => tie, cries => cri).
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: return len(w)==4 and w[:-1] or w[:-2]
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Delete -s if the preceding part contains a vowel not immediately before the -s
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # (so gas and this retain the -s, gaps and kiwis lose it).
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: Removes double consonants at the end of the stem and adds -e to some words.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: w = w[:-2] # Strip -ly for next step.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: return len(w)==4 and w[:-1] or w[:-2]
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Replace by -ee if preceded by at least one vowel-consonant pair.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: return R1(w).endswith("eed") and w[:-1] or w
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Delete if the preceding word part contains a vowel.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # - If the word ends -at, -bl or -iz add -e (luxuriat => luxuriate).
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # - If the word ends with a double remove the last letter (hopp => hop).
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # - If the word is short, add e (hop => hope).
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """ Step 1c replaces suffix -y or -Y by -i if preceded by a non-vowel
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: which is not the first letter of the word (cry => cri, by => by, say => say).
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: if len(w) > 2 and w.endswith(("y","Y")) and is_consonant(w[-2]):
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: This only happens if there is at least one vowel-consonant pair before the suffix.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: return R1(w).endswith(A) and w[:-len(A)] + B or w
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: if w.endswith("li") and R1(w)[-3:-2] in VALID_LI:
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Delete -li if preceded by a valid li-ending.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: This only happens if there is at least one vowel-consonant pair before the suffix.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: return R1(w).endswith(A) and w[:-len(A)] + B or w
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: This only happens if there is more than one vowel-consonant pair before the suffix.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: return R2(w).endswith(A) and w[:-len(A)] or w
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Delete -ion if preceded by s or t.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """ Step 5a strips suffix -e if preceded by multiple vowel-consonant pairs,
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: or one vowel-consonant pair that is not a short syllable.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: if R2(w).endswith("e") or R1(w).endswith("e") and not is_short_syllable(w, before=-1):
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """ Step 5b strips suffix -l if preceded by l and multiple vowel-consonant pairs,
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # - in, out and can stems could be seen as stop words later on.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """ Applies the letter case of the word to the stem:
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """ Sets the initial y, or y after a vowel, to Y.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: Of course, y is interpreted as a vowel and Y as a consonant.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: if ch == "y" and (p is None or p in VOWELS):
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # If we stemmed a word once, we can cache the result and reuse it.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # By default, keep a history of a 10000 entries (<500KB).
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """ Returns the stem of the given word: ponies => poni.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: Note: it is often taken to be a crude error
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: that a stemming algorithm does not leave a real word after removing the stem.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: But the purpose of stemming is to bring variant forms of a word together,
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: not to map a word onto its "paradigm" form.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: if cached and stem in cache:
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: if cached and len(cache) > history: # Empty cache every now and then.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # If the word has two letters or less, leave it as it is.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Mark y treated as a consonant as Y.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: for f in (step_1a, step_1b, step_1c, step_2, step_3, step_4, step_5a, step_5b):
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Turn any remaining Y letters in the stem back into lower case.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Apply the case of the original word to the stem.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f
